Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Explore available data on the world's fish stocks.
Fish stocks relative to the maximum sustainable yield
column3: Fish stocks are measured by their biomass: the number of individuals multiplied by their mass.\n\nHere it's measured as the biomass of a fish stock divided by the biomass at its maximum sustainable yield – the level at which we can catch the maximum amount of fish without a decline in fish populations. A value of one maximises fish catch without decreasing fish populations.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fish stocks relative to the management target
column3: Fish stocks are measured by their biomass: the number of individuals multiplied by their mass.\n\nHere it's measured as the biomass of a fish stock divided by the biomass at the management target level. A value of one means fish catch is optimal to achieve the intended level fo fish stocks.
Fish stocks are measured by their biomass: the number of individuals multiplied by their mass.
Fishing intensity measured the extent to which a stock is being exploited. This is the fraction of the fish population that is caught in a given year.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fishing intensity relative to the maximum sustainable yield
column3: Fishing intensity measured the extent to which a stock is being exploited. This is the fraction of the fish population that is caught in a given year.\n\nHere it's measured as the intensity divided by the intensity at the maximum sustainable yield – the level at which we can catch the maximum amount of fish without a decline in fish populations. A value of one is the optimal level to maximize fish catch without declining populations. Greater than one suggests overfishing.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fishing intensity relative to the management target
column3: Fishing intensity measured the extent to which a stock is being exploited. This is the fraction of the fish population that is caught in a given year.\n\nHere it's measured as the intensity divided by the intensity at the management target level. A value of one means fish catch is optimal to achieve the intended level fo fish stocks. Greater than one suggests overfishing.

Fish Stocks Data Explorer: Fish catch relative to catch at maximum sustainable yield
Fish catch relative to catch at management target
Abundance of fish relative to abundance at maximum sustainable yield
Abundance of fish relative to abundance at management target
Spawning stock biomass relative to biomass at maximum sustainable yield
Spawning stock biomass relative to biomass at management target
